trans-unit.source: HBase tutorial: Get started with Linux-based HBase clusters in Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: HBase tutorial: Get started with Linux-based HBase clusters in Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this HBase tutorial to get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Follow this HBase tutorial to get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Create tables from the HBase shell and query them using Hive.
trans-unit.target: Create tables from the HBase shell and query them using Hive.

trans-unit.source: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an HBase cluster in HDInsight, create HBase tables, and query tables by using Hive.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an HBase cluster in HDInsight, create HBase tables, and query tables by using Hive.

trans-unit.source: For general HBase information, see [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].
trans-unit.target: For general HBase information, see [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].

trans-unit.source: The information in this document is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The information in this document is specific to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on Windows-based clusters, use the tab selector on the top of the page to switch.
trans-unit.target: For information on Windows-based clusters, use the tab selector on the top of the page to switch.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this HBase tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this HBase tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: [Secure Shell(SSU)](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: [Secure Shell(SSU)](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: [curl](http://curl.haxx.se/download.html).
trans-unit.target: [curl](http://curl.haxx.se/download.html).

trans-unit.source: Create HBase cluster
trans-unit.target: Create HBase cluster

trans-unit.source: The following procedure use an Azure ARM template to create an HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure use an Azure ARM template to create an HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: To understand the parameters used in the procedure and other cluster creation methods, see [Create Linux-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: To understand the parameters used in the procedure and other cluster creation methods, see [Create Linux-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Click the following image to open an ARM template in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Click the following image to open an ARM template in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The ARM template is located in a public blob container.
trans-unit.target: The ARM template is located in a public blob container.

trans-unit.source: From the **Parameters** blade, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: From the **Parameters** blade, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: **ClusterName**: Enter a name for the HBase cluster that you will create.
trans-unit.target: **ClusterName**: Enter a name for the HBase cluster that you will create.

trans-unit.source: **ClusterStorageAccountName**: Each cluster has an Azure Blob storage account dependency.
trans-unit.target: **ClusterStorageAccountName**: Each cluster has an Azure Blob storage account dependency.

trans-unit.source: After you delete a cluster, the data retains in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: After you delete a cluster, the data retains in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster login name and password**: The default login name is **admin**.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster login name and password**: The default login name is **admin**.

trans-unit.source: **SSH username and password**: The default username is **sshuser**.
trans-unit.target: **SSH username and password**: The default username is **sshuser**.

trans-unit.source: You can rename it.
trans-unit.target: You can rename it.

trans-unit.source: Other parameters are optional.
trans-unit.target: Other parameters are optional.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to save the parameters.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to save the parameters.

trans-unit.source: From the **Custom deployment** blade, click **Resource group** dropdown box, and then click **New** to create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: From the **Custom deployment** blade, click **Resource group** dropdown box, and then click **New** to create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: The resource group is a container that groups the cluster, the dependent storage account and other linked resource.
trans-unit.target: The resource group is a container that groups the cluster, the dependent storage account and other linked resource.

trans-unit.source: Click **Legal terms**, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Legal terms**, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: It takes about around 20 minutes to create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: It takes about around 20 minutes to create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] After an HBase cluster is deleted, you can create another HBase cluster by using the same default blob container.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] After an HBase cluster is deleted, you can create another HBase cluster by using the same default blob container.

trans-unit.source: The new cluster will pick up the HBase tables you created in the original cluster.
trans-unit.target: The new cluster will pick up the HBase tables you created in the original cluster.

trans-unit.source: Create tables and insert data
trans-unit.target: Create tables and insert data

trans-unit.source: You can use SSH to connect to HBase clusters and use HBase Shell to create HBase tables, insert data and query data.
trans-unit.target: You can use SSH to connect to HBase clusters and use HBase Shell to create HBase tables, insert data and query data.

trans-unit.source: For information on using SSH from Linux, Unix, OS X and Windows, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md) and [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on using SSH from Linux, Unix, OS X and Windows, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md) and [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md).

trans-unit.source: For most people, data appears in the tabular format:
trans-unit.target: For most people, data appears in the tabular format:

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight hbase tabular data][img-hbase-sample-data-tabular]
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight hbase tabular data][img-hbase-sample-data-tabular]

trans-unit.source: In HBase which is an implementation of BigTable, the same data looks like:
trans-unit.target: In HBase which is an implementation of BigTable, the same data looks like:

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight hbase bigtable data][img-hbase-sample-data-bigtable]
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight hbase bigtable data][img-hbase-sample-data-bigtable]

trans-unit.source: It will make more sense after you finish the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: It will make more sense after you finish the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: **To use the HBase shell**
trans-unit.target: **To use the HBase shell**

trans-unit.source: From SSH, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: From SSH, run the following command:

trans-unit.target: Create an HBase with two column families:

trans-unit.target: Insert some data:

trans-unit.source: Get a single row
trans-unit.target: Get a single row

trans-unit.source: You will see the same results as using the scan command because there is only one row.
trans-unit.target: You will see the same results as using the scan command because there is only one row.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the HBase table schema, see [Introduction to HBase Schema Design][hbase-schema].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the HBase table schema, see [Introduction to HBase Schema Design][hbase-schema].

trans-unit.source: For more HBase commands, see [Apache HBase reference guide][hbase-quick-start].
trans-unit.target: For more HBase commands, see [Apache HBase reference guide][hbase-quick-start].

trans-unit.source: Exit the shell
trans-unit.target: Exit the shell

trans-unit.source: **To bulk load data into the contacts HBase table**
trans-unit.target: **To bulk load data into the contacts HBase table**

trans-unit.source: HBase includes several methods of loading data into tables.
trans-unit.target: HBase includes several methods of loading data into tables.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Bulk loading](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#arch.bulk.load).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Bulk loading](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#arch.bulk.load).

trans-unit.source: A sample data file has been uploaded to a public blob container, *wasb://hbasecontacts@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/contacts.txt*.
trans-unit.target: A sample data file has been uploaded to a public blob container, *wasb://hbasecontacts@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/contacts.txt*.

trans-unit.source: The content of the data file is:
trans-unit.target: The content of the data file is:

trans-unit.source: You can create a text file and upload the file to your own storage account if you want.
trans-unit.target: You can create a text file and upload the file to your own storage account if you want.

trans-unit.source: For the instructions, see [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].
trans-unit.target: For the instructions, see [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This procedure uses the Contacts HBase table you have created in the last procedure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This procedure uses the Contacts HBase table you have created in the last procedure.

trans-unit.source: From SSH, run the following command to transform the data file to StoreFiles and store at a relative path specified by Dimporttsv.bulk.output:.
trans-unit.target: From SSH, run the following command to transform the data file to StoreFiles and store at a relative path specified by Dimporttsv.bulk.output:.

trans-unit.source: If you are in HBase Shell, use the exit command to exit.
trans-unit.target: If you are in HBase Shell, use the exit command to exit.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to upload the data from /example/data/storeDataFileOutput to the HBase table:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to upload the data from /example/data/storeDataFileOutput to the HBase table:

trans-unit.source: You can open the HBase shell, and use the scan command to list the table content.
trans-unit.target: You can open the HBase shell, and use the scan command to list the table content.

trans-unit.source: Use Hive to query HBase
trans-unit.target: Use Hive to query HBase

trans-unit.source: You can query data in HBase tables by using Hive.
trans-unit.target: You can query data in HBase tables by using Hive.

trans-unit.source: This section creates a Hive table that maps to the HBase table and uses it to query the data in your HBase table.
trans-unit.target: This section creates a Hive table that maps to the HBase table and uses it to query the data in your HBase table.

trans-unit.source: Open **PuTTY**, and connect to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Open **PuTTY**, and connect to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: See the instructions in the previous procedure.
trans-unit.target: See the instructions in the previous procedure.

trans-unit.source: Open the Hive shell.
trans-unit.target: Open the Hive shell.

trans-unit.source: Run the following HiveQL script to create an Hive Table that maps to the HBase table.
trans-unit.target: Run the following HiveQL script to create an Hive Table that maps to the HBase table.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have created the sample table referenced earlier in this tutorial by using the HBase shell before you run this statement.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have created the sample table referenced earlier in this tutorial by using the HBase shell before you run this statement.

trans-unit.source: Run the following HiveQL script .
trans-unit.target: Run the following HiveQL script .

trans-unit.source: The Hive query queries the data in the HBase table:
trans-unit.target: The Hive query queries the data in the HBase table:

trans-unit.source: Use HBase REST APIs using Curl
trans-unit.target: Use HBase REST APIs using Curl

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When using Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster administrator.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When using Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the user name and password for the HDInsight cluster administrator.

trans-unit.source: You must also use the cluster name as part of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) used to send the requests to the server.
trans-unit.target: You must also use the cluster name as part of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) used to send the requests to the server.

trans-unit.source: For the commands in this section, replace **USERNAME** with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and replace **PASSWORD** with the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For the commands in this section, replace **USERNAME** with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and replace **PASSWORD** with the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Replace **CLUSTERNAME** with the name of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace **CLUSTERNAME** with the name of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: The REST API is secured via [basic authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication).
trans-unit.target: The REST API is secured via [basic authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication).

trans-unit.source: You should always make requests by using Secure HTTP (HTTPS) to help ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.
trans-unit.target: You should always make requests by using Secure HTTP (HTTPS) to help ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.

trans-unit.source: From a command line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: From a command line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.target: You should receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: {"status":"ok","version":"v1"}
trans-unit.target: {"status":"ok","version":"v1"}

trans-unit.source: The parameters used in this command are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The parameters used in this command are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to list the exisiting HBase tables:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to list the exisiting HBase tables:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a new HBase table wit two column families:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a new HBase table wit two column families:

trans-unit.source: The schema is provided in the JSon format.
trans-unit.target: The schema is provided in the JSon format.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to insert some data:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to insert some data:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to get a row:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to get a row:

trans-unit.source: Check cluster status
trans-unit.target: Check cluster status

trans-unit.source: HBase in HDInsight ships with a Web UI for monitoring clusters.
trans-unit.target: HBase in HDInsight ships with a Web UI for monitoring clusters.

trans-unit.source: Using the Web UI, you can request statistics or information about regions.
trans-unit.target: Using the Web UI, you can request statistics or information about regions.

trans-unit.source: SSH can also be used to tunnel local requests, such as web requests, to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: SSH can also be used to tunnel local requests, such as web requests, to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The request will then be routed to the requested resource as if it had originated on the HDInsight cluster head node.
trans-unit.target: The request will then be routed to the requested resource as if it had originated on the HDInsight cluster head node.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md#tunnel).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md#tunnel).

trans-unit.source: **To establish an SSH tunneling session**
trans-unit.target: **To establish an SSH tunneling session**

trans-unit.source: Open **PuTTY**.
trans-unit.target: Open **PuTTY**.

trans-unit.source: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account during the creation process, you must perform the following step to select the private key to use when authenticating to the cluster:
trans-unit.target: If you provided an SSH key when you created your user account during the creation process, you must perform the following step to select the private key to use when authenticating to the cluster:

trans-unit.source: In **Category**, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and select **Auth**.
trans-unit.target: In **Category**, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and select **Auth**.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click **Browse** and select the .ppk file that contains your private key.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click **Browse** and select the .ppk file that contains your private key.

trans-unit.source: In **Category**, click **Session**.
trans-unit.target: In **Category**, click **Session**.

trans-unit.source: From the Basic options for your PuTTY session screen, enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: From the Basic options for your PuTTY session screen, enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Host Name**: the SSH address of your HDInsight server in the Host name (or IP address) field.
trans-unit.target: **Host Name**: the SSH address of your HDInsight server in the Host name (or IP address) field.

trans-unit.source: The SSH address is your cluster name, then **-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: The SSH address is your cluster name, then **-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: For example, *mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net*.
trans-unit.target: For example, *mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net*.

trans-unit.source: The ssh port on the head node 0 is 22.
trans-unit.target: The ssh port on the head node 0 is 22.

trans-unit.source: In the **Category** section to the left of the dialog, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then click **Tunnels**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Category** section to the left of the dialog, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then click **Tunnels**.

trans-unit.source: Provide the following information on the Options controlling SSH port forwarding form:
trans-unit.target: Provide the following information on the Options controlling SSH port forwarding form:

trans-unit.source: **Source port** - The port on the client that you wish to forward.
trans-unit.target: **Source port** - The port on the client that you wish to forward.

trans-unit.source: For example, 9876.
trans-unit.target: For example, 9876.

trans-unit.source: **Dynamic** - Enables dynamic SOCKS proxy routing.
trans-unit.target: **Dynamic** - Enables dynamic SOCKS proxy routing.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** to add the settings.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** to add the settings.

trans-unit.source: Click **Open** at the bottom of the dialog to open an SSH connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Open** at the bottom of the dialog to open an SSH connection.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, log in to the server using a SSH account.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, log in to the server using a SSH account.

trans-unit.source: This will establish an SSH session and enable the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: This will establish an SSH session and enable the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: **To find the FQDN of the zookeepers using Ambari**
trans-unit.target: **To find the FQDN of the zookeepers using Ambari**

trans-unit.source: Browse to https://<ClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/.
trans-unit.target: Browse to https://<ClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/.

trans-unit.source: Enter your cluster user account credentials twice.
trans-unit.target: Enter your cluster user account credentials twice.

trans-unit.source: From the left menu, click **zookeeper**.
trans-unit.target: From the left menu, click **zookeeper**.

trans-unit.source: Click one of the three **ZooKeeper Server** links from the Summary list.
trans-unit.target: Click one of the three **ZooKeeper Server** links from the Summary list.

trans-unit.source: Copy **Hostname**.
trans-unit.target: Copy **Hostname**.

trans-unit.source: For example, zk0-CLUSTERNAME.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.cx.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, zk0-CLUSTERNAME.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.cx.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: **To configure a client program (Firefox) and check cluster status**
trans-unit.target: **To configure a client program (Firefox) and check cluster status**

trans-unit.source: Open Firefox.
trans-unit.target: Open Firefox.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Open Menu** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Open Menu** button.

trans-unit.source: Click **Options**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Options**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Advanced**, click **Network**, and then click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Advanced**, click **Network**, and then click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Manual proxy configuration**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Manual proxy configuration**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Socks Host**: localhost
trans-unit.target: **Socks Host**: localhost

trans-unit.source: **Port**: Use the same port you configured in the Putty SSH tunnelling.
trans-unit.target: **Port**: Use the same port you configured in the Putty SSH tunnelling.

trans-unit.source: For example, 9876.
trans-unit.target: For example, 9876.

trans-unit.source: **SOCKS v5**: (selected)
trans-unit.target: **SOCKS v5**: (selected)

trans-unit.source: **Remote DNS**: (selected)
trans-unit.target: **Remote DNS**: (selected)

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to save the changes.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to save the changes.

trans-unit.source: Browse to http://<TheFQDN of a ZooKeeper>:60010/master-status
trans-unit.target: Browse to http://<TheFQDN of a ZooKeeper>:60010/master-status

trans-unit.source: In a high availability cluster, you will find a link to the current active HBase master node that is hosting the Web UI.
trans-unit.target: In a high availability cluster, you will find a link to the current active HBase master node that is hosting the Web UI.

trans-unit.source: Next steps?
trans-unit.target: Next steps?

trans-unit.source: In this HBase tutorial for HDInsight, you learned how to create an HBase cluster and how to create tables and view the data in those tables from the HBase shell.
trans-unit.target: In this HBase tutorial for HDInsight, you learned how to create an HBase cluster and how to create tables and view the data in those tables from the HBase shell.

trans-unit.source: You also learned how use a Hive query on data in HBase tables and how to use the HBase C# REST APIs to create an HBase table and retrieve data from the table.
trans-unit.target: You also learned how use a Hive query on data in HBase tables and how to use the HBase C# REST APIs to create an HBase table and retrieve data from the table.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see:

trans-unit.source: [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview]: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.
trans-unit.target: [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview]: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.
